item.title: Bondada Engineering Reports 107% Revenue Surge, Files Official BSE Update
item.description: Top News Bondada Engineering Reports 107% Revenue Surge, Files Official BSE Update 37 minutes ago Bondada Engineering achieved exceptional 107% consolidated revenue growth as of November 2025, officially communicated through BSE filing on December 11, 2025. The infrastructure company surpassed previous year's total turnover while outlining strategic commitments to enhance stakeholder value, strengthen market presence, and leverage emerging business opportunities through disciplined execution and customer-centric delivery.

item.title: Seamec Secures USD 16.72 Million Vessel Charter Agreement with G R Infraprojects
item.description: Seamec Secures USD 16.72 Million Vessel Charter Agreement with G R Infraprojects 5 minutes ago Seamec Limited has officially announced a USD 16.72 million subcontract agreement with G R Infraprojects Limited for charter hire of vessel 'Seamec III' over 150 days. The contract involves subsea installation and diving operations for ONGC's pipeline replacement projects, representing a significant business development in the company's normal course of operations.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens 20 hours ago Indian stock markets ended negative, with Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex both down 0.32%. Market breadth favored decliners, with 2,382 stocks falling versus 2,166 advancing. IndiGo's operational crisis, Biocon's biologics consolidation, ICICI Bank's stake increase in its AMC, Infosys' Vietnam expansion, and Pine Labs' AI-powered bill pay feature were key highlights. The cautious sentiment was influenced by various corporate developments and global cues.

item.title: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price
item.description: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price 16 hours ago Vidya Wires Limited debuted on BSE at ₹52.13 per share, trading above its IPO issue price of ₹52.00. The listing reflects a modest premium of ₹0.13, representing approximately 0.25% gains over the offer price. The successful market debut enables regular trading of the company's shares on the exchange.
